gurmukhi: jbY jsoDw suie geI mwXw kIXo pRkwS ]fwr ikSn iqh pY suqw lInI hY kr qws ]68]
transliteration: Jahai Jasodhoo Sue Gadmaayaa Keeyo Prakaadh|| Daar Kishan Tih Pai Soutaa Leenidar Taas||68||
translation: On this side when Yashoda went to sleep and Yoga-maya (deceptive show) appeared in her womb; putting Krishna by the side of Yashoda, Vasudev picked up her daughter and started backwards.68.

gurmukhi: mwXw ko lY kr mY bsdyv su SIGR clXo Apny giH mwhI ]soie gey pr duAwr sBY Gr bwhir BIqir kI suiD nwhI ]
transliteration: Maayaa Ko Lai Kar Mai Basdev Su Sheeghra Chadyo Apne Grah(i) Maahee|| Soe Gad Par Duaar Sabhai Ghar Baahar(i) Bheetar(i) Kisudh(i) Naahee||
translation: Taking Maya in his hands, Vasudev quickly went to his house and at that time all the people were sleeping and none had the consciousness about the happenings inside and outside;

gurmukhi: dyvkI qIr gXo jbhI sB qy imlgy pt Awpis mwhI ]bwl auTI jb rodn kY jg kY suiD jwie krI nr nwhI ]69]
transliteration: Devakiteer Gado Jab-hisabh Te Milge Pat Aapas(i) Maahee||69||
translation: When Vasudev came near Devaki, the doors closed themselves; when the servants heard the cries of the female infant, they informed the king.69.

gurmukhi: roie auTI vh bwl jby qb sRonn mY suin lI Duin horY ]Dwie gey niRp kMsih ky Gir jwie khXo jnmXo irp qorY ]
transliteration: Roe Outhivah Baal Jabe Tab Sronan Mai Soun(i) Lidhoun(i) Horai|| Dhaae Gad Nrip Kansah(i) Ke Ghar(i) Jaae Kahyo Janmyo Rip Torai||
translation: When that female infant wept, then all the people heard her cries, the servants ran to inform the king, they told him that his enemy had taken birth;

gurmukhi: lY ky kiRpwn gXo iqhkY cil jwie ghI krqY kr jorY ]dyKhu bwq mhw jV kI Ab Awidk ky ibK cwbq BorY ]70]
transliteration: Lai Ke Kridaan Gado Tih-kai Chal(i) Jaae Gadikartai Kar Jorai|| Dekhoh Baat Mahaa Jar Kiab Aadik Ke Bikh Chaabat Bhorai||70||
translation: Holding fast his sword in both his hands Kansa went there; look at the vicious action of this great fool, who himself is going to drink the poison i.e. he himself is preparing for his own death.70.

gurmukhi: lwie rhI aur so iqh ko muK qy khXo bwq suno mqvwry ]puqR hny mm pwvk sy CT hI qum pwQr pY hn fwry ]
transliteration: Laae Rahiko Moukh Te Kahyo Baat Kahyo Baat Souno Matvdare|| Poutra Hane Mam Paavak Se Chhath Hitoum Paathar Pai Han Ddare||
translation: Devaki had hugged the female infant to her bosom; she said, “O fool ! listen to me, you have already killed my radiant sons by dashing them against the stones;”

gurmukhi: CIn kY kMs khXo muK qy ieh BI ptkO ieh kY Ab nwry ]dwsn hY lhkI nB mY jb rwK leI vh rwKnhwry ]71]
transliteration: Chheen Kai Kans Kahyo Oumkh Te Eh Bhipatkau Eh Kai Ah Ndare|| Daamanndhai Lahakinabh Mai Jab Raakh Laivah Raakhannddare||71||
translation: Hearing these words Kansa immediately seized the infant and said, “Now, I shall also kill her by dashing her.” When Kansa did all that, then this infant, who was protected by the Lord, went as lightning in the sky and flased.71.

gurmukhi: kY kY kRoD mn kir bXoq vwky mwrby kI cwkrn khXo mwr fwro niRp bwq hY ]kr mo auTwiekY bnwie Bwro pwQr pY rwj kwj rwKby ko kCu nhI pwq hY ]
transliteration: Kai Kai Krodh Man Kar(i) Byot Vaake Maarbe Kichaaran Kahyo Maar Ddare Nrip Baat Hai|| Kar Mo Udhaae-kai Banaae Bhdaro Paathar Pai Raaj Kaaj Raakhbe Ko Kachhu Nahipaat Hai||
translation: Kansa said to his servants in great fury and after great consideration, “I order you to kill her;” holding her in dashed against a huge stone;

gurmukhi: Apno so bl kr rwKY ieh BlI BwNiq sÍMd CMd bMd kY kY CUt ieh jwq hY ]mwXw ko bFwie kY su sBn sunwiekY su AYsy aufI bwrw jYsy pwrw auf jwq hY ]72]
transliteration: Apno So Bal Kar Raakhai Eh Bhalibhaant(i) Svand Chhand Band Kai Chhodht Eh Jaat Hai|| Maayaa Ko Badhaae Kai Su Sabhan Sounaae-kai Su Aise Udibaaraa Jaise Paaraa Ud Jaat Hai||72||
translation: But inspite of being held in such strong hands, she herself was slipping away and spattering; because of the impact of maya, she splashed like mercury, causing everyone to listen to her voice.72.

gurmukhi: AwT Bujw kirkY ApnI sBno kr mY br AwXuD lIny ]jÍwl inkws khI muK qy irp Aaur BXo qusro miq hIno ]
transliteration: Ooth Bhujaa Kar(i)kai Apnisabhno Kar Mai Bar Aayudh Leene|| Jvaal Nikaas Kahimoukh Te Rip Aur Bhayo Toumro Mat(i) Heene||
translation: This maya manifested herself assuming eight arms and holding her weapons in her hands; the flames of fire were coming out of her mouth, she said, “O foolish Kansa ! your enemy has taken birth at another place;”

gurmukhi: dwmn sI lhkY niB mY frkY Ptgy iqh S`qRn sIny ]mwr frY ieh hUM hmhUM sB qRws mny Aiq dYqn kIny ]73]
transliteration: Daamanndsilahkai Nabh(i) Mai Dar-kai Phatge Tih Shattran Seene|| Maar Dar-kai Phatge Tih Shattran Seene|| Maar Darai Ehdhoondham-hoon Sabh Tras Mane At(i) Daitan Keene||73||
translation: Saying this much, and crating fear in the hearts of the enemies, she began to wave like lightning in the sky and all the demons became fearful thinking that she may kill all of them.73.
